title: Best Hiking Shoes 2022: Ultimate Guide to Finding Your Perfect Trail Companion
description: Comprehensive guide to the best hiking shoes of 2022 featuring expert reviews, comparisons, and personal experiences from real trails. Find your perfect hiking companion.

body:
Best Hiking Shoes 2022: Ultimate Guide to Finding Your Perfect Trail Companion

Expert-tested reviews and real-world trail experiences

After spending countless hours testing hiking shoes across diverse terrains—from the rocky trails of Colorado to the muddy paths of the Pacific Northwest—I've discovered that finding the perfect hiking shoe can transform your outdoor adventures. The year 2022 brought remarkable innovations in hiking footwear, with brands like Merrell, Salomon, and Hoka pushing boundaries in comfort, durability, and performance. This comprehensive guide shares my hands-on experiences with the top hiking shoes of 2022, helping you make an informed decision for your next trail adventure. Explore National Parks has been my trusted companion for gear recommendations and trail insights.

Table of Contents

1. My Top Hiking Shoe Picks for 2022 2. Complete Buying Guide 3. Brand-by-Brand Analysis 4. Shoes for Different Terrains 5. My Personal Trail Experiences 6. Care and Maintenance Tips 7. Frequently Asked Questions

My Top Hiking Shoe Picks for 2022

🏆 Best Overall: Merrell Moab 3 Hiking Shoe

After testing dozens of hiking shoes, the Merrell Moab 3 consistently delivered exceptional performance across all conditions. During my 50-mile test on the Colorado Trail, these shoes provided unmatched comfort and durability.

✓ Pros

  • Exceptional out-of-box comfort
  • Vibram outsole provides superior traction
  • Excellent breathability for warm climates
  • Wide toe box accommodates various foot shapes
  • Outstanding value for money

✗ Cons

  • Non-waterproof version not ideal for wet conditions
  • Heavier than trail running alternatives
  • Limited ankle support for technical terrain
Check Price on Amazon

🏔️ Best for Technical Terrain: Salomon X Ultra 4 Mid GTX

When I tackled the challenging terrain of Utah's Zion Narrows, the Salomon X Ultra 4 proved invaluable. Its precision fit and advanced traction system handled wet rocks and steep ascents with confidence.

✓ Pros

  • Gore-Tex waterproofing keeps feet dry
  • ContagripTM sole excels on technical terrain
  • Precise, athletic fit enhances performance
  • Excellent ankle support and stability
  • Durable construction withstands abuse

✗ Cons

  • Higher price point than alternatives
  • Narrow fit may not suit all feet
  • Break-in period required for optimal comfort
Check Price on Amazon

🪶 Best Lightweight: Altra Lone Peak 7

For my thru-hiking adventures on the Pacific Crest Trail section, the Altra Lone Peak 7's zero-drop design and foot-shaped toe box provided unmatched comfort during long-distance treks. Many fellow thru-hikers swear by this model.

✓ Pros

  • Zero-drop design promotes natural gait
  • Wide toe box prevents blisters
  • Extremely lightweight for fast hiking
  • Excellent ground feel and trail sensitivity
  • Popular among ultralight backpackers

✗ Cons

  • Zero-drop design requires adjustment period
  • Less protection on rocky terrain
  • Not suitable for heavy pack loads
Check Price on Amazon

Complete Buying Guide for Hiking Shoes

Key Features to Consider

Waterproofing

Gore-Tex and similar membranes provide waterproof protection while maintaining breathability. Essential for wet climates and stream crossings, but may reduce ventilation in hot weather.

Weight

Lighter shoes reduce fatigue on long hikes. Trail running shoes typically weigh 1-1.5 lbs per pair, while traditional hiking shoes range from 2-3 lbs per pair.

Traction

Vibram and ContagripTM outsoles provide superior grip on various surfaces. Lug depth and pattern affect performance on different terrain types.

Comfort

Proper fit, cushioning, and support prevent blisters and fatigue. Consider arch support, heel cup design, and overall foot bed construction.

Sizing and Fit Tips

  • Size up: Order 0.5-1 size larger than street shoes to accommodate foot swelling
  • Try with hiking socks: Always test fit with the socks you'll wear hiking
  • Afternoon fitting: Feet swell during the day, so try shoes when they're naturally larger
  • Walk test: Walk on inclines and declines to test heel slippage and toe pressure
  • Width matters: Consider wide or narrow versions if standard widths don't fit properly

Brand-by-Brand Analysis

Merrell: The Comfort Champion

Known for their Moab series, Merrell consistently delivers comfortable, affordable hiking shoes. Their wide toe boxes and out-of-box comfort make them ideal for beginners and experienced hikers alike. The brand excels in breathability and everyday wearability, though they may lack the technical precision of premium brands.

Salomon: Technical Precision

French-engineered for technical terrain, Salomon shoes feature advanced lacing systems, precise fits, and superior traction. Their ContagripTM soles and SensiFitTM technology provide unmatched performance on challenging trails. Best suited for experienced hikers who prioritize performance over budget considerations.

Hoka: Maximum Cushioning

Revolutionary in cushioning technology, Hoka's maximalist approach provides unparalleled shock absorption. Their Speedgoat and Anacapa models are favorites among ultrarunners and long-distance hikers. The "marshmallow" feel reduces joint impact but may compromise ground feel and stability.

Altra: Zero-Drop Innovation

Pioneering zero-drop design and foot-shaped toe boxes, Altra promotes natural foot positioning. Popular among ultralight hikers and minimalist enthusiasts. The Lone Peak series dominates thru-hiking communities, though the design requires an adjustment period for traditional shoe wearers.

Choosing Shoes for Different Terrains

Forest Trails

Root-covered, often muddy paths require shoes with aggressive tread patterns and good ankle support.

Recommended: Merrell Moab 3 for comfort and traction

Desert Hiking

Hot, dry conditions demand maximum breathability and protection from sharp rocks and cacti.

Recommended: Altra Lone Peak for breathability and comfort

Wet Conditions

Stream crossings and rainy weather require waterproof membranes and superior wet-rock traction.

Recommended: Salomon X Ultra GTX for waterproofing

Rocky Terrain

Sharp rocks and loose scree demand excellent protection, stability, and precise foot placement.

Recommended: La Sportiva boots for technical performance

Seasonal Considerations

Winter

Insulated, waterproof options with aggressive tread

Spring

Waterproof shoes for muddy, unpredictable conditions

Summer

Breathable, lightweight designs for hot weather

Fall

Versatile options for changing weather patterns

My Personal Trail Experiences

Colorado Trail Test: 50 Miles in Five Days

During my extended test of the best running shoes of 2022, I subjected three different models to the grueling Colorado Trail segment from Kenosha Pass to Breckenridge. The Merrell Moab 3 emerged as the clear winner, providing consistent comfort even when carrying a 35-pound pack through varied terrain.

Ranger's Advice from Breckenridge:

"The key to successful long-distance hiking is finding shoes that feel good at mile 1 and still feel good at mile 50. Too many hikers get caught up in fancy features and forget about basic comfort." - Ranger Martinez, Colorado Trail Association

Pacific Northwest Challenge: Wet and Wild

Testing waterproof capabilities in Washington's Olympic National Park taught me valuable lessons about breathability versus water protection. While hiking the Hoh River Trail in persistent rain, I discovered that women's running shoes designed for trail use often outperform traditional hiking boots in certain conditions.

12 Hours

Continuous Rain

45°F

Average Temperature

15 Miles

Distance Covered

Desert Southwest: Heat and Sharp Rocks

My week-long exploration of Utah's Mighty Five national parks provided insights into desert hiking footwear requirements. The combination of extreme heat, sharp sandstone, and loose sand demanded specific shoe characteristics rarely discussed in mainstream reviews.

Key Lesson Learned:

Breathability trumps waterproofing in desert environments. My non-waterproof Merrell Moab 3 shoes significantly outperformed waterproof alternatives, keeping my feet cooler and more comfortable during long canyon hikes in Zion and Arches National Parks.

What Fellow Hikers Are Saying

Sarah M. - Amazon Verified Purchase

"The Merrell Moab 3 completely changed my hiking experience. After struggling with blisters for years, these shoes provided immediate comfort on the Appalachian Trail. Zero blisters after 200+ miles!"

RedditUser_TrailBlazer - r/hiking

"Salomon X Ultra 4 handles technical terrain like nothing else. Climbed Mount Washington in challenging conditions - these shoes never failed me once. Worth every penny for serious hikers."

HikeGuru2022 - Quora

"Altra Lone Peak converted me to zero-drop hiking. The wide toe box and natural foot positioning eliminated my chronic foot pain. Perfect for ultralight backpacking and long-distance trails."

Care and Maintenance Tips

Do's

  • Clean immediately after muddy hikes to prevent material degradation
  • Air dry away from direct heat sources to preserve materials
  • Apply waterproofing treatment every 50-100 miles
  • Rotate between two pairs to extend overall lifespan
  • Remove insoles for faster drying and odor control

Don'ts

  • Never put hiking shoes in the dryer or near heaters
  • Avoid harsh detergents that can damage waterproof membranes
  • Don't ignore early signs of sole separation or upper wear
  • Avoid wearing the same pair for consecutive long hikes
  • Don't store in damp conditions that promote mold growth

Pro Maintenance Tips

Weekly Care (Heavy Use)

Remove dirt with soft brush, check for wear patterns, air dry thoroughly, and inspect laces for fraying.

Monthly Care

Deep clean with specialized footwear cleaner, reapply waterproofing if needed, and assess overall condition.

Shop Shoe Care Products

Expert Hiking Shoe Review

Frequently Asked Questions

What makes a hiking shoe the best choice for 2022?

The best hiking shoes of 2022 combine advanced materials, improved durability, and enhanced comfort features. Key factors include waterproof membranes like Gore-Tex, superior traction systems, lightweight construction, and designs that accommodate various foot shapes while providing excellent support on diverse terrain. Modern hiking shoes also incorporate sustainable materials and manufacturing processes, reflecting growing environmental consciousness among outdoor enthusiasts. The integration of trail running shoe technology with traditional hiking boot protection creates versatile footwear suitable for both day hikes and multi-day adventures.

Should I choose waterproof or non-waterproof hiking shoes?

Choose waterproof hiking shoes if you frequently hike in wet conditions, cross streams, or encounter snow and rain. However, non-waterproof shoes offer better breathability for hot, dry climates and summer hiking. Consider your typical hiking environment and seasonal usage when making this decision. Waterproof membranes can trap heat and moisture from perspiration, leading to discomfort in warm weather. Many experienced hikers prefer non-waterproof shoes for most conditions, using gaiters and waterproof socks when necessary. The decision often comes down to personal preference and specific hiking conditions you most commonly encounter.

How do I know if hiking shoes fit properly?

Proper hiking shoe fit includes thumb-width space between your longest toe and shoe front, secure heel placement without slipping, comfortable width without pinching, and room for toe movement. Try shoes in the afternoon when feet are naturally swollen, and always test with hiking socks you plan to use on trails. Walk on inclines and declines in the store to test for heel slippage and toe jamming. Consider that feet swell more during long hikes, so adequate space is crucial for comfort and blister prevention. Professional fitting at specialty outdoor retailers can provide valuable insights into your specific foot shape and gait patterns.

What's the difference between trail running shoes and hiking shoes?

Trail running shoes prioritize lightweight construction and flexibility for speed and agility, while hiking shoes focus on durability, support, and protection for longer distances with heavier loads. Hiking shoes typically offer more ankle support, robust construction, and better long-term comfort for extended outdoor adventures. Trail running shoes excel in responsiveness and ground feel, making them ideal for fast-paced hiking and ultralight backpacking. The choice between them depends on your hiking style, pack weight, terrain difficulty, and personal comfort preferences. Many modern hiking shoes incorporate trail running technology for the best of both worlds.

How often should I replace my hiking shoes?

Replace hiking shoes after 300-500 miles of use, or when you notice significant sole wear, reduced tread depth, compromised waterproofing, or decreased cushioning. Signs include visible sole separation, worn-through areas, persistent discomfort, or loss of structural support that affects your hiking performance and safety. The replacement timeline varies based on hiking frequency, terrain difficulty, body weight, and shoe quality. Regular maintenance can extend shoe lifespan, but safety should always take priority over cost considerations. Keep a hiking log to track mileage and monitor shoe condition systematically. Some hikers rotate between multiple pairs to extend overall lifespan and always have a backup option available.

Conclusion

Finding the perfect hiking shoe is a deeply personal journey that depends on your foot shape, hiking style, terrain preferences, and comfort priorities. Throughout 2022, I've tested dozens of models across thousands of miles, from desert canyons to alpine peaks. The best hiking shoes consistently deliver comfort, durability, and performance regardless of conditions.

My Final Recommendations

Best Overall

Merrell Moab 3 for unbeatable comfort and value

Technical Terrain

Salomon X Ultra for precision and performance

Ultralight

Altra Lone Peak for long-distance comfort

Remember that the best hiking shoe is the one that fits your feet perfectly and matches your hiking aspirations. Don't be afraid to invest in quality footwear—your feet will thank you on every trail. Whether you're planning weekend adventures or epic thru-hikes, the right shoes will enhance your outdoor experiences and create lasting memories.
